channel.title: Cracking a piczo password protected webpage
channel.description:
Hey,
Well anyways a friend of mine has a piczo(yuck) webpage. One part of the site is password protected, and she wont give me a password :P
The password system seems fairly simple, and is basically a web based form, where you just enter a password. I tried to whole view>source thing, but the password was not in there, and my "hacking" abilities end right there, lol.
If anyone knows how to get a piczo web page password, then that'd be great if you could tell me. If you want the website, pm me. I dont want to hand it out to everyone though.

item.title: Cracking a piczo password protected webpage
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“jason2gs, post:12, topic:38088”]“For gods sake… are you retarded? Is it too d~~n hard for you to use www.google.com?”

Lol[br][size=1]Posted at: December 22, 2006, 07:03:28 PM[/size][hr]Is access diriver clean/safe to download? Kaspersky ran out today, can’t check it myself.[/quote]
I did use google. See I am one of those people that can learn to learn, but I couldnt find anything on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cracking a piczo password protected webpage
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

Meh, sorry for the false alarm.

You can of course do it the lame way, launch a brute force attack. There are lots of brute forcers out there. I would suggest Access Diver for the job.
